page.title: 17N.York Moors National Park.
page.content:
The entire block, except for about 2.5 hectares north of Eskdaleside road is within the National Park. The {objectives of a National Park}are "to preserve and enhance the natural beauty" of the area, "to promote its enjoyment by the public", but at the same time "to pay due regard" to local needs.
{Schemes for}the{ management} of the uplands,and for the planting of native deciduous trees, are there to help the land owners to "conserve the essential character" of the area and can assist in resolving conflicts of land use.
The provision of the{Bluebank Top Car {Park}and the "beehive" litter bins may have reduced picnicking and perhaps sheep kills, elsewhere on the A169.
